articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Meets New Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Meets New Vietnamese Ambassador 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun met and had a talk with Le Quang Ba, new Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday when the latter paid a courtesy call on him.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Arrives
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Arrives 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference led by Vice-Chairman Chen Zongxing arrived here Monday.
					 The C.C., the Democratic Front for the Reunification of Korea gave a reception for the delegation.

articles.title: Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair Opens
articles.content:
Pyongyang Spring Int'l Trade Fair Opens 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The 14th Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair opened at the Three-Revolution Exhibition Monday with due ceremony.
					 Present there were Vice-Premier Kang Sok Ju, Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam, officials in the field of foreign trade and delegations from several countries and regions.
					
					 Diplomatic envoys of several countries and officials of foreign embassies here were also present.
					
					 Kim Mun Jong, director of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, made an opening address to be followed by a congratulatory speech by O Ryong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Trade.
					
					 The speakers said that the fair will provide multi-lateral economic and trade activities and scientific and technological exchanges among several countries and regions, expressing hope that the entrants would gain good success through broad contacts.
					
					 The DPRK will further economic and cooperative relations with other countries on the principles of equality and mutual benefits, they said.
					
					 After the opening ceremony the attendants looked round exhibits from companies of the DPRK, China, Germany, Malaysia, Mongolia, Syria, Switzerland, Singapore, Britain, Australia, Austria, Italy, Indonesia, France, Poland and Taipei of China.
					
					 A reception as regards the opening of the fair was given at Pyongyang Koryo Hotel the same day.

articles.title: Nano Technology-based Goods
articles.content:
Nano Technology-based Goods
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The New Technology Trading and Exchange Company of the DPRK has made more than ten kinds of goods based on nano technology.
					 The goods include mobile and household sterilized water box, grass-made shoes liners, fabric goods and water disinfectant.
					
					 They, which won prizes at the 25th National Festival of Science and Technology in 2010, were all granted quality authentication.
					
					 The shoes liners remove bad smell caused by microorganism, sweat and secretion, and prevents water-eczema. It also promotes blood circulation of feet.
					
					 The water box makes minerals and other ingredients of water easily absorptive to human body. Light rays make it more germicidal.
					
					 The sterilized water helps prevent colitis and diarrhea.

articles.title: DPRK Student Proves Successful at Int'l Art Olympiad
articles.content:
DPRK Student Proves Successful at Int'l Art Olympiad 
 Moscow, May 16 (KCNA) -- Pak Ji Hyok, a student of the DPRK, proved successful in the piano contest of the 2nd International Art Olympiad.
					 This Olympiad held in Moscow from May 7 to 9 brought together students of more than 10 countries and regions including the DPRK, Russia, Germany, Ukraine, Turkey and Moldova.
					
					 13 years old Pak was praised by members of the jury and experts for fully meeting the requirements of the given music by unique rendition.
					
					 A cup and diploma were awarded to him who finished second.
					
					 A professor at Moscow Tchaikovsky State Conservatory of Russia who is chairman of the jury for the piano contest appreciated the rare rendition displayed by him, adding that this helped him guess the appearance of the children in the DPRK.

articles.title: Jongbangchae, Specialty of North Hwanghae Province
articles.content:
Jongbangchae, Specialty of North Hwanghae Province  
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Jongbangchae, a specialty of North Hwanghae Province, the DPRK, is a foodstuff made with radish preserved in salt water.
					 The Sariwon Jongbang Foodstuff Producers’Cooperative produces foodstuffs with various kinds of vegetables, including pickles, one of the Korean people's traditional dishes.
					
					 The products enjoy popularity among local people, particularly travelers.
					
					Jongbangchae was named by President Kim Il Sung in the early 1970s.

articles.title: Moran Hill Fragrant with Flowers
articles.content:
Moran Hill Fragrant with Flowers
						
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Many people climb Moran Hill, one of the scenic spots in Pyongyang, to enjoy flower scent.
					In spring the hill is fragrant with various sorts of flowers.
					
					 The road to the Moranbong Theatre is lined with red-blossoming peach trees and the Moran Restaurant and Ondal Pavilion are surrounded by lilacs.  
					
					 Royal azaleas and yellow roses give off sweet odors around the Ulmil Pavilion and swarms of bees are buzzing over white-blossomed plum trees near the Liberation Tower.
					
					 Rim Chun Gyu, chief engineer of the Moran Hill Management Office, told KCNA that the hill is covered by hundreds of thousands of flowering trees of some 200 species.

articles.title: Three Celebrated Musicians of Korea in Middle Age
articles.content:
Three Celebrated Musicians of Korea in Middle Age
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Wang San Ak, Uruk and Pak Yon are well know as three great musicians of Korea in the middle age.
					 Wang San Ak, who lived in the period of Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D.688), made contributions to national musical development by improving and performing musical instruments and creating musical pieces.
					
					 A legend says that notes of instruments played by him were so beautiful that cranes gathered and danced over him.
					
					 Uruk, active as a musical composer and performer and educator in the early 6th century, invented Kayagum, a national musical instrument, and popularized it in the country.
					
					 He created a lot of Kayagum tunes and brought up musicians.
					
					 Pak Yon was a musical theorist and instrumentalist in the early period of the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910). He collected native Korean musical pieces, invented 12 tunes suitable for national rhythms, and made and improved musical instruments. He compiled "Sejong Musical Characters", a full orchestral score, and others to systematize in a theoretical and practical way Korean music in the middle age.

articles.title: Earring of Koguryo People
articles.content:
Earring of Koguryo People
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- One of the cultural relics dating back to Koguryo Kingdom (B.C. 277-A.D. 668) is earring.
					 Various kinds of luxuries were made with precious metals in the period of Koguryo, which reached a certain level of development in mining and refining industries.
					
					 Earring is diverse in kind, shape and decoration.
					
					 There are thick and thin, rectangular and cone earrings of different decorative patterns.

articles.title: New Method of Liver Operation
articles.content:
New Method of Liver Operation 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Scientists of a country recently developed a new method of liver operation. 
					 The operation uses a small instrument the tip of which has a special electrode which scorches the affected part of liver by sending high-frequency waves.
					
					 This instrument helps form a layer on the surface of liver through which blood can not pass through, enabling doctors to exenterate the damaged part with ordinary surgical knives.
					
					 This method reportedly can be used to remove metastasized cancer from liver.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Demands End to Separatist Moves of S. Korean Authorities
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Demands End to Separatist Moves of S. Korean Authorities
						
Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- It is the solemn requirement of the reality to put an end to the moves of the south Korean authorities for confrontation with the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in a bylined article.
					To improve the relations between the north and the south of Korea is an important way for defusing the confrontation and tension on the Korean Peninsula and solving the issue of reunification by peaceful means, the article says, adding:
					
					It is the consistent will of the DPRK to pave a wide avenue for peace and reunification and national prosperity by averting the danger of war in the peninsula by the concerted efforts of the Korean nation on the basis of the historic June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and putting an end to the history of confrontation between fellow countrymen.
					
					The long history of national division clearly shows that there is nothing but continued division and terrible war disaster for the north and the south to get from escalation of distrust and confrontation. Moreover, the Koreans keenly realized again in the last three years since the emergence of the present south Korean conservative authorities that confrontation can never be a solution to the issue of the north-south relations and this will only bring armed conflict and war.
					
					Dialogue between the north and the south is an important matter related to the destiny of the nation and the prospect of national reunification, and it is for common interests and prosperity of both sides. If the south Korean authorities persistently check the resumption of north-south dialogue, putting up unreasonable preconditions which can never work on the DPRK, the deteriorated inter-Korean relations will never be improved. The ruling forces of south Korea should, above all, take proper attitude and stand toward the dialogue.
					
					Those separatists who are set to stand in the way of the dialogue for an indefinite period will never evade a stern punishment by history and the nation.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks under Fire 
						
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak, while touring Germany recently, uttered wherever he went there that "nukes of the north are obstructive to reunification," urging "it to dismantle them." He cried out for the north's "apology" for the warship sinking and the Yonphyong Island shelling incident and even the "punishment" of it, justifying the anti-DPRK conspiratorial farces orchestrated in the past. He, at the same time, dared slander and attack the system in the DPRK, bringing to light his daydream of "emerging a victor" in the confrontation of the systems. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a signed commentary in this regard: All what traitor uttered is nothing but reckless remarks which can be made only by a confrontation maniac. 
					
					 His outbursts are a blatant challenge and deliberate provocation against the system in the DPRK and its supreme dignity and an intolerable mockery of all Koreans desirous of the improved north-south relations. 
					
					 In a word, his German trip can be described as a junket of a traitor to chill the atmosphere of dialogue swimming against the trend of the times, evade the responsibility for driving the north-south relations into a total collapse and justify his treacherous "policy towards the north".
					
					 What is more intolerable is that he talked about the pull-down of the Berlin Wall and "unification" of Korea, obsessed by the wild ambition to escalate the confrontation of the systems. These were ridiculous jargons, indeed. 
					
					 His reckless remarks clearly suggest that the conservative group remains unchanged even a bit in its policy of confrontation towards fellow countrymen and only seeks the confrontation of the systems and a war of aggression against the DPRK. 
					
					 Lee Myung Bak will be held responsible for the consequences to be entailed by his light-headed behaviors and reckless remarks.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun on Korean-style Socialism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun on Korean-style Socialism 
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Korean-style socialism is the road leading to making the Korean revolution ever-victorious. The Korean people will never step back even an inch from this road. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in a jointly signed article.
					
					 To preserve the nature of socialism is the eternal lifeline of Korean-style socialism, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 Capitalism is the society based on individualism while socialism is the society based on collectivism. Therefore, the nature of socialism lies in collectivism. President Kim Il Sung built socialism centered on the popular masses, guided by the Juche idea, for the first time in history and provided the advantages of Korean-style socialism one by one as required by it.
					
					 For us to preserve the nature of socialism means, in the final analysis, protecting the socialist system, the collectivist ownership and collectivist lifestyle provided by the President and the socialist gains won by the Korean people at the cost of blood and sweat. Preserving the nature of socialism precisely means defending socialism and boundlessly glorifying it. 
					
					 To preserve the nature of socialism, in particular, presents itself as an important issue in frustrating the imperialists' moves against socialism and successfully building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					  It is thanks to the original Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il that the nature of socialism is firmly preserved and its vitality is given full play with each passing day in the DPRK. 
					
					  The article underscores the need to dynamically advance the general drive for improving the standard of people's of living under his leadership and demonstrate the invincible might and dignity of Korean-style socialism before the whole world.

articles.title: DLP of S. Korea on Pitiful Plight of Workers
articles.content:
DLP of S. Korea on Pitiful Plight of Workers
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea in a commentary on May 11 deplored the disastrous state of the workers caused by the group of traitors' murderous dismissal step.
					 Referring to the sudden death of a worker fired at the Ssangyong Motorcar Plant on May 10, the commentary said that 15 young workers died of dismissal at the plant so far.
					
					 Nevertheless, the present "government" persists in only the anti-worker policy without making any apology, it charged.
					
					 The "government" and the business side should bear the blame for this situation and opt for settling the issue immediately, it said.

articles.title: Authorities' Unpopular Stockbreeding Policy Attacked in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Unpopular Stockbreeding Policy Attacked in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Catholic, Buddhist, Christian, Chondoist and other religious organizations and the Environment Committee of the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea jointly called a press conference outside the general office of the "government" in Seoul on May 11 to protest the puppet authorities' unpopular stockbreeding policy.
					 At the conference speakers said that the "proposal for updating stockbreeding", unilaterally pushed forward by the "government", is killing stockbreeding on the contrary.
					
					 Stockbreeding has been seriously attacked by the foot-and-mouth diseases, which swept all areas, and environment disaster is coming up due to the authorities' rough burying of domestic animals, they deplored.
					
					 They said that the diseases are still breaking out but the "government" pursues only the misrule driving stockbreeding to a crisis while engaging itself in the attempt to conceal the developments.
					
					 They demanded that the authorities take correct measures, not putting the blame on budget.

articles.title: Unity of Progressive Forces Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Unity of Progressive Forces Called for in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Ri Kang Sil, permanent co-representative of the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea, called for the unity of progressive forces on May 12 when interviewed by a reporter of Internet newspaper Jaju Minbo.
					 The Kwangju popular resistance 31 years ago provided the people an opportunity to clearly see the true colors of the U.S., Ri said, adding: Through the resistance all the people keenly realized that democracy and reunification cannot be achieved without independence.
					
					 All the progressive forces should get united to punish the present regime and realize progressive politics by inheriting the spirit of the Kwangju uprisers, Ri stressed.
					
					 The unity of progressive forces should be based the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration, Ri said, calling upon the people to vigorously struggle with optimism and conviction that independence, democracy and reunification will surely be realized.

articles.title: Decision on Holding World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed
articles.content:
Decision on Holding World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed
						
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Russia and Switzerland released statements in support of the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea (IIJI).
					 The Russian Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, in its statement on May 10, said that it is of weighty significance to convene a world conference on the Juche idea in Pyongyang in April 2012 on the occasion of the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Friends of Russia faithful to the Juche idea and the human cause of independence fully support the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the IIJI Board of Directors, the statement said, adding: They deem it very happy to attend the conference and witness at first hand the achievements made by the Korean people in building a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea, in its statement on May 7, noted that General Secretary Kim Jong Il has developed and enriched the Juche idea, the Songun idea founded by the President and led the struggle against the U.S. and the cause of Korea's reunification to victory with his Songun politics.
					
					 It further said:
					
					 We fully support and welcome the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the IIJI Board of Directors.
					
					 We will conduct on a wider scale the study and dissemination of the Juche idea together with its followers and peace-loving progressives the world over and thus make positive contribution to commemorating the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung as a great auspicious event in the history of humankind.

articles.title: Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Seminar on Kim Jong Il's Work Held in Bangladesh
						
Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- A seminar on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" was held by the Bangladesh Barisal Society for the Study of Songun Policy on May 10 to mark the 11th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 M. Jahangir Khan, advisor of the Society, and other speakers explained that in the work Kim Jong Il systematized in a comprehensive way the immortal exploits of President Kim Il Sung who devoted all his life to the cause of national reunification.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated as the three charters for national reunification the three principles of national reunification, the 10-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo, advanced by the President, and set them as the important guidelines to be held fast to by all the Koreans, they stressed.
					
					 They stressed that the three charters are reunification programme most correctly reflecting the unanimous will of the Korean nation and concrete reality of the country.
					
					 They expressed belief that the Korean nation would surely achieve independent and peaceful reunification of the country under the banner of the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Russian PM Stresses on Economic Development
articles.content:
Russian PM Stresses on Economic Development 
 Moscow, May 14 (KCNA) -- Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin stressed on the issue of economic development at the meeting of the Machine Manufacturers' Union on May 11. 
					 Russia should rank among world economic powers in terms of the gross domestic product within a decade, he said, adding that it means the quality development based on new technology and high efficiency in the traditional industry and new fields, not competition for quantity. 
					
					 Russia should have all technical and industrial production processes and the home business groups be made masters in machine building, in particular, he stressed.

articles.title: China Intensifies Education of Children
articles.content:
China Intensifies Education of Children
 Beijing, May 14 (KCNA) -- The All-China Women's Federation, the Office of Central Spiritual Civilization Construction Commission of the Communist Party of China and 16 other units recently issued a joint notice in which they called on all the parts of the country and all the fields to organize education activities on diverse themes on the occasion of June 1, the International Children's Day.
					 The notice called for dynamic information service about the history and good traditions of the party and the system on the core value of socialism among children so as to help them nurture the spirit of loving the party, the country and socialism.

articles.title: Indonesia Plans to Build Solar Cell Power Generators
articles.content:
Indonesia Plans to Build Solar Cell Power Generators
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Indonesia is planning to build solar cell power generators to meet the growing need for electricity.
					 Indonesia's Energy and Mineral Resources Minister Darwin Zahedy Saleh said on Wednesday that the country would construct solar cell power generators with total capacity of 180 Mega Watt by 2013.
					
					 The government decided to allot much fund to this work.

articles.title: Iran Will Not Stop Producing Enriched Uranium
articles.content:
Iran Will Not Stop Producing Enriched Uranium
						
Tehran, May 14 (KCNA) -- Atomic Energy Organization of Iran Director Fereydoun Abbasi, when interviewed by a news agency recently, said that Iran would not stop producing uranium enriched to a purity level of 20 percent.
					 The AEOI plans to build four to five new reactors, with a capacity of 10 to 20 megawatts, in different provinces of Iran in the next few years, and thus it needs to continue producing the fuel needed for the reactors, he said.
					
					 The Islamic Republic of Iran will not seek anybody's permission to do so, he stated.

articles.title: Trade Unbalance between US and Japan Gets Serious
articles.content:
Trade Unbalance between US and Japan Gets Serious
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Imbalance in trade between the U.S. and Japan is getting serious, increasing their economic contradiction.
					 The trade deficit with Japan in March jumped 15.6 percent from the previous month to $6.06 billion, the U.S. Commerce Department said on Wednesday.

articles.title: Economic Growth in Countries of East African Community
articles.content:
Economic Growth in Countries of East African Community
						
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The economy has grown nearly twice in countries of the East African Community for the past 15 years as compared with the previous period, according to a report released by the Community on May 10.

articles.title: 8 Killed in US Drone Strike in Pakistan
articles.content:
8 Killed in US Drone Strike in Pakistan
						
 Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan are committing murderous atrocities against Pakistanis almost every day under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least eight people were killed in a U.S. drone strike launched Thursday morning in Pakistan's northwest tribal area of North Waziristan.

articles.title: FAO Urges to Curb Global Food Waste
articles.content:
FAO Urges to Curb Global Food Waste 
Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- The food waste and loss is coming up as a serious problem worldwide.
					 According to a report made by the UN Food and Agriculture Organization Wednesday, roughly one third of the food produced in the world for human needs every year goes lost or squandered, amounting to 1.3 billion tons.

articles.title: Fraudulent Medicines Rampant Worldwide
articles.content:
Fraudulent Medicines Rampant Worldwide
Pyongyang, May 16 (KCNA) -- Fraudulent medicines are rampant worldwide, arousing serous concern.
					 About 3 in 10 pharmaceutical products in the combined African, Asian and Latin American markets are said to be faked ones.
					
					 A UN report clarified this on May 12.

articles.title: Publicada 3ª parte del acta del grupo de inspección del CDN
articles.content:
Publicada 3ª parte del acta del grupo de inspección del CDN
						
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ATCC) -- El día 14, el Grupo de Inspección del Comité de Defensa Nacional  de la República Popular Democrática de Corea publicó la tercera parte del acta de revelación de la verdad para dar al conocimiento público el siniestro objetivo con que la camarilla de traidores surcoreanos inventa tercer y cuarto "incidentes del hundimiento de la corbeta ´Cheonan´" sin liberarse todavía de sus ambiciones anacrónicas.
					  El acta citó más pruebas reveladoras de lo fraudulento del "rumor de vinculación del Norte" con el incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta surcoreana "Cheonan", que siguen difundiendo hasta la fecha los traidores surcoreanos a pesar de que todo el mundo conoció que ese caso se trató de un complot de máxima dimensión para el enfrentamiento fratricida entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					  El texto resumido del acta sigue abajo:
					
					  Si bien la RPDC recurrió a todos los medios y métodos para la solución justa e imparcial del caso de "Cheonan", quedaron cerradas las posibilidades debido a la parte surcoreana que rehusó todas las iniciativas de la primera.
					
					  En estas circunstancias, el Grupo de Inspección del Comité de Defensa Nacional de la RPDC delató a todo el mundo a través del acta de revelación que el polémico incidente fue un complot de mayor envergadura ideado y ejecutado por la camarilla de traidores surcoreanos.
					
					  Lejos de arrepentirse de su crimen, los títeres surcoreanos, que pasaron tremenda pena a la vista del mundo, optaron por fraguar el segundo incidente de "Cheonan": el fuego artillero en la isla Yonphyong del año pasado.
					
					  Para ampliar el perímetro de enfrentamiento fratricida de los planos político y militar a los dominios sociales, ellos siguen fabricando nuevos casos.
					
					  El Servicio Nacional de Inteligencia y la fiscalía títeres del Sur de Corea publicaron el día 3 que el "Norte es el autor" de la paralización de la "red de computación financiera" de la Federación Nacional de las Cooperativas Agrícolas del Sur de Corea.
					
					  Al cabo de la "investigación intensiva" de más de 20 días, los títeres surcoreanos sacaron primero la "conclusión provisional" de que ese incidente es producto de un "atentado ciber-terrorista del exterior". Unos días después, publicaron el resultado de investigación presumiendo que eso fue "cometido por el Norte".
					
					  Por otra parte, difunden en todo el territorio surcoreano el rumor de la "amenaza proveniente del Norte" alarmando que éste puede seguir ocasionando daños fatales en las instalaciones claves relacionadas con la seguridad del Sur de Corea como las instituciones de autoridades, aeropuertos, puertos, centrales nucleares, etc.
					
					  Ese caso resulta idéntico al incidente de "Cheonan", excepto a su carácter social, tanto en su causa como en su método de ejecución.
					
					  El incidente de "Cheonan" aconteció cuando EE.UU. necesitaba un caso drástico de la "inseguridad" para procurar el pretexto de la ocupación perpetua del suelo surcoreano, con que justificaría la dilación de entrega al Sur de Corea del mando de operaciones en el tiempo de guerra.
					
					  Para encubrir una vez por todas la verdad de lo ocurrido, los conspiradores escogieron el lugar y la hora inconvenientes al esclarecimiento, específicamente, las aguas jurisdiccionales de una parte en lugar de alta mar, por debajo del mar en vez de la superficie del mar y las horas avanzadas de la noche.
					
					  El incidente costó la vida de 46 soldados inocentes.
					
					  El "rumor de la autoría del Norte" de la paralización de la "red de computación financiera" de la Federación Nacional de las Cooperativas Agrícolas del Sur de Corea flotó cuando en el ámbito interno, se arma la trifulca entre "Chongwadae" y el "Gran Partido Nacional" para imputar uno al otro la responsabilidad por la derrota aplastante sufrida en las elecciones suplementarias del 27 de abril como castigo del pueblo encolerizado por las políticas antipopulares y de parte externa, se fraguan las artimañas para rehusar la exigencia de los países circunvecinos de la Península Coreana de que el Sur de Corea acceda a las conversaciones.
					
					  Esta vez, la Federación Nacional de las Cooperativas Agrícolas del Sur de Corea fue escogida como chivo expiatorio porque los muy astutos traidores surcoreanos pretendieron imputar a la RPDC la responsabilidad de los males sociales agudizados durante el mandato de ellos como la depauperación de la vida del pueblo y la abismal diferencia entre los pobres y los ricos.
					
					  Todos los hechos insinúan que seguirán produciéndose el cuarto y quinto complots anti-RPDC mientras ellos continúen en su febril campaña conflictiva con el Norte difundiendo el "rumor de vinculación de éste".
					
					  El incidente de "Cheonan" llevó al borde de guerra las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					  La nación coreana, víctima de la división territorial del país, alcanzó a duras penas las valiosas conquistas de la era de reunificación comenzada desde la publicación de la Declaración Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio.
					
					  Esos logros se echaron a perder en un instante debido a la demencial campaña de enfrentamiento fratricida de los traidores surcoreanos y se reproduce la fea situación de la Guerra Fría.
					
					  El Grupo de Inspección del CDN de la RPDC no parará nunca sus esfuerzos por aclarar la verdad mientras la camarilla surcoreana actúe desesperadamente para frenar el desarrollo de relaciones N-S vinculando obstinadamente a la RPDC con el caso de "Cheonan".
					
					  Nuestro Grupo de Inspección del CDN exige fuertemente a la banda de traidores surcoreanos que pida oficialmente la disculpa a toda la nación coreana al  asumir la responsabilidad por haber fabricado dichos complots que calumnian a la connacional RPDC.
					
					  Volvemos a dejar en claro que el ejército y el pueblo de la RPDC tienen la firme posición de no tratar jamás con los que se atrevan a burlarse e insultar la dignidad independiente y el sistema socialista de la RPDC.
					
					  Si practican de continuo su política conflictiva con la RPDC rehusando lo que exigimos, los traidores surcoreanos serán condenados y repudiados por todas las generaciones venideras al registrarse en la historia nacional como artífices de los complots de mayor envergadura, connotados elementos conflictivos sin parangón y estropeadores de la reunificación.

articles.title: Inaugurada 14ª exposición internacional de mercancías
articles.content:
Inaugurada 14ª exposición internacional de mercancías 
						
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ATCC) -- Quedó inaugurada el día 16 en la Exposición Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones la XIV Exposición Internacional de Mercancías Primaveral de Pyongyang.
					En la ceremonia inaugural estuvieron presentes el vicepremier del Consejo de Ministros Kang Sok Ju, el ministro de Comercio Exterior Ri Ryong Nam, los funcionarios de la rama de comercio, las delegaciones de varios países y regiones, los representantes diplomáticos e integrantes de las embajadas de varios países en Corea.
					
					Luego del discurso de apertura del director de la Agencia de Exposición Internacional de Corea, Kim Mun Jong, el viceministro coreano de Comercio Exterior, O Ryong Chol, pronunció la palabra de felicitación.
					
					Los oradores dijeron que durante la feria, se realizarán las actividades económicas y comerciales multilaterales y el intercambio científico-técnico entre varios países y regiones, y desearon que los participantes logren magníficos éxitos a través de amplios contactos.
					
					Destacaron que en el futuro también, la República Popular Democrática de Corea desarrollará más las relaciones de cooperación económica con otros países en el principio de igualdad y beneficio mutuo.
					
					Terminada la inauguración, los participantes pasaron revista a los objetos exhibidos por las compañías de la RPDC, China, Alemania, Malasia, Mongolia, Siria, Suiza, Singapur, Gran Bretaña, Australia, Austria, Italia, Indonesia, Francia, Polonia y Taipei China.
					
					El mismo día, con motivo de la inauguración de la feria, se ofreció un banquete en el Hotel Coryo de Pyongyang.

articles.title: Artículos de industria ligera hechos con nano-tecnología
articles.content:
Artículos de industria ligera hechos con nano-tecnología
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ATCC) -- Últimamente, la Compañía de Intercambio y Comercio de Nuevas Tecnologías de Corea inventó más de una decena de artículos de industria ligera aplicando la nano-tecnología.
					  Entre ellos figuran el pomo esterilizador portátil y de uso doméstico, la plantilla de paja, la toalla y otros artículos de fibra y de desinfección del agua, etc.
					
					  Ganaron el certificado de calidad y resultaron apreciados en el XXV Festival Central de Ciencia y Técnica efectuado en 2010.
					
					  La plantilla de paja elimina la peste generada por los microorganismos, el sudor y las secreciones dentro del zapato y previene el eccema.
					
					  Además, promueve la circulación de sangre en los píes.
					
					  El pomo de agua convierte las sustancias minerales y otras contenidas en el agua, de modo que fueran absorbidas fácilmente en el cuerpo humano, y demuestra efectos esterilizantes más fuertes cada vez que se exponga a la luz.
					
					  La toma del agua procesada con la nano-tecnología permite prevenir y tratar varias enfermedades como inflamación de intestino grueso y diarrea.

articles.content:
Visitas
Pyongyang, 16 de mayo (ATCC) -- Partió el día 14 de esta capital la delegación de las Ediciones en Lenguas Extranjeras presidida por el vicedirector Ri Min Chon para realizar una visita a China.
					Por otra parte, el mismo día arribaron aquí las delegaciones de China, Australia, Austria, Francia y Taipei de China para participar en 14ª Exposición Internacional de Mercancías Primaveral de Pyongyang.
					
					Con anterioridad, llegaron a esta capital las delegaciones de Mongolia, Siria e Italia.
